Package FX.Model.Entities

Class Entities

java.lang.Object
FX.Model.Entities.Entities
Direct Known Subclasses:
Ball, Brick, Paddle
public abstract class Entities
extends java.lang.Object
this is an abstract class which is used to indicate that the classes that extends it is an entity object.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors

    Entities​(javafx.geometry.Point2D position, javafx.scene.paint.Color borderColor, javafx.scene.paint.Color innerColor, int width, int height)
    this constructor is used to set the entities variable.

  • Constructor Details

    • Entities

      public Entities​(javafx.geometry.Point2D position, javafx.scene.paint.Color borderColor, javafx.scene.paint.Color innerColor, int width, int height)
      this constructor is used to set the entities variable.
      Parameters:
      position - this is the top left position of the entity
      borderColor - this is the border color of the entity.
      innerColor - this is the inner color of the entity.
      width - this is the width length of the entity.
      height - this is the height length of the entity.

  • Method Details

    • setImpact

      public boolean setImpact​(javafx.geometry.Point2D point, int dir)
      this method returns true as it is used when there is a collision occurred. (set this false to disable multi-ball)
      Parameters:
      point - this is the point fo impact between the entities.
      dir - this is the direction of impact.
      Returns:
      this returns true.

    • resetPosition

      public void resetPosition()
      this method is used to reset the position of the entity.

    • getBounds

      public javafx.geometry.BoundingBox getBounds()
      this method is used to get the bounding box of the entity.
      Returns:
      this returns the bounding box object of the entity.

    • setBounds

      public void setBounds​(javafx.geometry.BoundingBox bounds)
      this method is used to set the bounding box of the entity into a variable for future reference.
      Parameters:
      bounds - this is the bounding box object used to set into a variable of the entity for future reference.

    • getFixedInitialPosition

      public javafx.geometry.Point2D getFixedInitialPosition()
      this method is used to get the initial top left position of the entity.
      Returns:
      this returns the top left position of the entity.

    • setFixedInitialPosition

      public void setFixedInitialPosition​(javafx.geometry.Point2D fixedInitialPosition)
      this method is used to set the top left position of the entity into a variable which is the initial position of the entity.
      Parameters:
      fixedInitialPosition - this is the position that is going to be set into a variable which is the initial position of the entity.

    • getBorderColor

      public javafx.scene.paint.Color getBorderColor()
      this method is used to get the border color of the entity.
      Returns:
      this returns the border color of the entity.

    • setBorderColor

      public void setBorderColor​(javafx.scene.paint.Color borderColor)
      this method is used to set the border color of the entity.
      Parameters:
      borderColor - this is the color used to set it into a variable which is the border color of the entity.

    • getInnerColor

      public javafx.scene.paint.Color getInnerColor()
      this method is used to get the inner color of the entity which is going to be used to draw on the screen.
      Returns:
      this returns the inner color of the entity.

    • setInnerColor

      public void setInnerColor​(javafx.scene.paint.Color innerColor)
      this method is used to set the inner color of the entity for future references.
      Parameters:
      innerColor - this is the color used to set the inner color of the entity.

    • getWidth

      public int getWidth()
      this method is used to get the width of the entity
      Returns:
      this is the width of the entity.

      this method is used to set the width of the entity.

      this method is used to get the height of the entity.
